name: api_tool_copy
description: Retrieves the current weather for a given location.
The AI uses this tool to fetch temperature, humidity, and condition data for any specified location.
units (string) — one of metric or imperial
appid (string) — do not populate; this is set by the API definition
Populate only parameters mentioned or inferable from the user request.
If the user asks for Fahrenheit, set units=imperial.
If the user gives a city name instead of coordinates, use a known mapping if available:
Omit unknown parameters; do not guess coordinates.
Return the tool’s JSON response as-is; the agent may summarize for readability.
“What’s the weather in Düsseldorf?” → { lat: 51.2277, lon: 6.7735, units: "metric" }
“Show me the weather for Oslo in Fahrenheit.” → { lat: 59.9139, lon: 10.7522, units: "imperial" }
“Get the temperature for Berlin.” → { lat: 52.52, lon: 13.405, units: "metric" }
